title: Elected MPs sworn in
byline: The swearing-in ceremony of newly elected Members of Parliament (MPs) took place at the 10th Parliament today.

title: Ashoka Sapumal Ranwala elected as new Speaker
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Gampaha MP Dr. Ashoka Sapumal Ranwala was elected as the Speaker of the 10th Parliament of Sri Lanka a short while ago.

title: 10th parliament session commences
byline: The ceremonial opening of the tenth Parliament commenced a short while ago marking a significant change after more than half a century.

title: Half of child population may be nearsighted by 2050 due to screen use
byline: Thirty percent of children are nearsighted due to prolonged use of digital screens, and the World Health Organisation predicts that this figure will rise to 50 percent by 2050, Lady Ridgeway Children’s Hospital (LRH) Ophthalmologist Dr. Anusha Thennekumbura said.

title: Appointment of PM and Cabinet before Parliament meets is constitutional- Saliya Pieris PC
byline: Former President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL), Saliya Pieris, PC, stated that there is no basis for claims made by certain factions that the Prime Minister and Cabinet could not have been sworn in prior to the meeting of Parliament, rendering their appointments legally invalid.

title: Ceremonial opening of 10th Parliament to go down in the history
byline: The ceremonial opening of the tenth Parliament today will go down in history for a number of reasons as it is set to be different after more than a half a century.

title: Man gunned down in Dikwella
byline: A 48-year-old man riding a motorcycle was shot dead in Walasgala, Dikwella, this morning.

title: U.S. indicts Indian billionaire Gautam Adani in $265 million bribery scheme
byline: An Indian businessman who is one of the world’s richest people has been indicted in the U.S. on charges he duped investors by concealing that his company’s huge solar energy project on the subcontinent was being facilitated by an alleged $265 million bribery scheme.

title: 10 arrested with 160kg of narcotics
byline: Ten suspects have been arrested in Gandara, Matara with 160 kg of crystal methamphetamine (ICE) and 60 kg of heroin by the Matara Divisional Crimes Detective Bureau (DCDB).

title: SL targets US $ 36bn in annual exports by 2029
byline: The government has set its sights on an ambitious annual export revenue target of US $ 36 billion to be achieved by 2029, according to the Export Development Board (EDB).

title: Former CB Governor confident of IMF review completion by February
byline: Senior Economist and former Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy expressed optimism about the completion of the third review of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) bailout package by mid-February next year, as stipulated by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: CEB reports turnaround performance in 3Q despite tariff cuts
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) reported a turnaround performance in the three months through September 2024, at both top and bottom-line levels, as the state-owned power behemoth turned to black, helped by the repeatedly raised tariffs in the last two years, despite the cuts to power tariffs earlier in the quarter.

title: Katkolam Army Camp land in North disbanded
byline: In a move under the Army’s restructuring plan, an 8-acre land of the Katkolam Army camp in the north will be returned to civilians, the Army said.

title: ’I am eligible for national list slot’: Hirunika
byline: Hirunika Premachandra said today that she is eligible for the National List slot in the event the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) decides to allocate one of its five slots to a woman.

title: Vietnamese women indulging in the ‘oldest profession’ nabbed by Immigration sleuths
byline: A group of Vietnamese women engaged in running two high end brothels in Colombo by charging up to Rs.35,000 to 50, 000 from their clients were taken into custody by the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) today.

title: A/L exams cannot be postponed, all preparations finalised: Ministry
byline: Despite requests from several parties to postpone the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examinations, the Education Ministry announced today that it cannot be delayed, as all preparations have been finalised to conduct the exams as scheduled.

title: Higher priority for education, schools to follow systematic approach: Harini Amarasuriya
byline: According to the new government policies, higher priority has been given to education, and school education should be implemented in a proper, systematic manner and according to a well-defined schedule, Education Minister Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Government to import 70,000 tonnes of Nadu rice
byline: The government has decided to import Nadu rice subject to maximum of 70,000 tonnes as a solution to the shortage of rice in the market, Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development Wasantha Samarasinghe said today.

title: Information desk for fresh Members of Parliament concludes successfully
byline: The Information Desk set up for the newly elected Members of Parliament for the inaugural sitting of the First Session of the Tenth Parliament, held at the Parliamentary Complex yesterday (19) and today (20), concluded successfully.

title: Pilleyan leaves CID after giving 5-hour long statement
byline: Former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, also known as Pilleyan, left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after giving a 5-hour long statement about the controversial Channel 4 documentary on the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks in Sri Lanka.

title: Low pressure area likely to form over southeast Bay of Bengal by Saturday
byline: A low-pressure area is likely to form over the southeast Bay of Bengal around Saturday (23) and is likely to intensify into a depression over southwest Bay of Bengal during the two days, the Meteorological Department said.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu offers $5m reward for captives freed from Gaza
byline: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said $5m will be given as a reward for each captive released from Gaza and those that help free Israelis held by Hamas will be given a way out of the war-torn Palestinian territory.

title: Schoolboy dies following earth slip in Medamahanuwara, two injured
byline: A 16-year-old schoolboy, who was trapped under a mound of earth after an earthslip,  died after being rescued early this morning.

title: X-Press Feeders hits out at long-term detention of master in Sri Lanka
byline: X-Press Feeders has hit out at the “bureaucratic and legal hurdles” that have caused severe delays in the case of the X-Press Pearl, a boxship that caught fire in 2021 causing one of Sri Lanka’s worst-ever environmental disasters. The master of the ship has not been able to leave the Asian island for the past 1,280 days.

title: Probe underway into death of pregnant woman at Mannar Hospital
byline: The Ministry of Health has initiated an investigation into the tragic death of a pregnant woman and her unborn child at the Mannar District General Hospital.

title: Mahinda Siriwardana assumes duties as treasury secretary
byline: K M Mahinda Siriwardana assumed duties as the Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development today.

title: Rafael Nadal Retires from Tennis
byline: With tears in his eyes, Rafael Nadal said goodbye to professional tennis on Tuesday.

title: Trump picks WWE co-founder Linda McMahon for education secretary
byline: Trump picks WWE co-founder Linda McMahon for education secretary

title: Ravi’s crisis beyond EC’s control
byline: The controversy surrounding the nomination of Ravi Karunanayake as an MP on the National List representing the New Democratic Front (NDF) is beyond the control of the Election Commission, according to its chairman.

title: SAFE Sloth Bear Team visits Sri Lanka
byline: A 14-member team from the Saving Animals from Extinction (SAFE) Sloth Bear Programme of the American Association of Zoos and Aquariums is currently in Sri Lanka.

title: Third school term holiday starts tomorrow
byline: The first phase of the third term for all government-approved Sinhala and Tamil schools will end tomorrow, marking the beginning of school holidays, the Ministry of Education announced.

title: Independent MP refuses to vacate Opposition Leader’s seat
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Archuuna Ramanathan refused to move away after he sat on the Opposition Leader’s seat inside the chambers despite requests by Parliament staff to move.

title: Surgery removes 10 kg tumor from uterus in Kataragama
byline: A surgery to remove a 10 kg tumor from the uterus of a woman has been reported from the Kataragama area.

title: Parliament adjourned until December 3
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake adjourned the Sri Lankan Parliament until 9:30 a.m. on December 3.

title: President announces salary hike for Govt. employees in budget
byline: A fair salary increase will be granted to all Government employees in the upcoming budget proposal, the President said in his policy statement during the 10th parliamentary session.

title: Smuggler arrested with 300 tarantulas strapped to his body
byline: Police in Peru have arrested a man caught trying to leave the country with 320 tarantulas, 110 centipedes and nine bullet ants strapped to his body.

title: Vote on account in December, new budget in March next year: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament that a vote on account will be presented in December this year while a budget will be presented by March next year.

title: President promises increase in ’Aswesuma’ welfare payments to combat poverty
byline: The President assured an increase in the amount allocated for the ’Aswesuma’ welfare benefit payments as the first step toward eradicating poverty.

title: Government to boost IT workforce to 200,000 in five years
byline: The government is expecting to increase the number of Information Technology (IT) professionals to 200,000 within five years to meet the challenges of the global IT market.

title: Australia proposes bill to restrict under-16s on social media, fines for tech firms
byline: The Australian government is threatening multimillion dollar fines for social media companies that breach a proposed ban on children under 16 from using their service.

title: Government expected to sign new staff level agreement with IMF by Friday
byline: The Government expects to sign a new staff level agreement with the IMF by Friday, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: SriLankan Airlines wins best entertainment award in Central/Southern Asia
byline: SriLankan Airlines has won the prestigious 2025 APEX Best Entertainment Award in Central/Southern Asia at the FTE APEX Asia Expo, held on 20 November 2024 in Singapore.

title: No one will enjoy legal immunity in our government: President
byline: No one will enjoy legal immunity under the present Government, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament a shortwhile ago.

title: President vows to prevent racist politics and religious extremism
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka assured that racist politics would not be allowed to appear again at any cost and confirmed that the issues of religious extremism would not be raised in the country.

title: President arrives at Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived at Parliament a short while ago to deliver the government’s Policy Statement during the ceremonial sitting of the first session of the 10th Parliament.

title: Sajith Premadasa accepted as Opposition Leader
byline: Speaker Dr. Ashoka Sapumal Ranwala informed Parliament that nomination of Sajith Premadasa, leader of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), has been accepted as the Opposition Leader of the 10th Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: Parliament adjourned until 11:30 a.m.
byline: Parliament adjourned until 11:30 a.m., and the Speaker requested one representative from each political party that contested the election to attend a party leaders’ meeting in his official room.

title: Mohammed Rizvi Sally elected as deputy speaker
byline: NPP MP Mohammed Rizvi Sally was elected Deputy Speaker following a proposal by MP Nalinda Jayatissa, seconded by MP Saroja Savithri Paulraj.

title: Special unit to address crop damage by toque monkeys and other animals
byline: The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation has established a special unit to address the issue of harmful animal populations causing significant damage to crops. This initiative aims to implement multiple strategies for sustainable control.

title: Ravi K’s nomination on National List, NDF has violated original agreement: Wajira
byline: The United National Party (UNP) today disputed claims by its member Ravi Karunanayake that there was an electoral agreement to offer a National List slot to a nominee by the New Democratic Front (NDF) whose gas cylinder symbol was used to contest the General Election this time in alliance with others.

title: SLMC appoints M.S. Naleem as national list MP
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) has named M.S. Naleem, the former Chairman of the Eravur Urban Council, as its National List Member of Parliament (MP).

title: ICC issues arrest warrant for Benjamin Netanyahu for alleged Gaza war crimes
byline: The international criminal court has issued arrest warrants for the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, the country’s former defence minister Yoav Gallant and the Hamas leader Mohammed Deif for alleged war crimes relating to the Gaza war.
